lead_paragraph: A group of fourth graders in the East Village have turned a classroom closet into an unlikely dig site, unearthing old coins, candy wrappers and other ephemera from earlier times.

headline.print_headline: Young Treasure Hunters Dig Up History Lessons
headline.main: Young Treasure Hunters Dig Up History Lessons in a Classroom’s Closet

snippet: A group of fourth graders in the East Village have turned a classroom closet into an unlikely dig site, unearthing old coins, candy wrappers and other ephemera from earlier times.
abstract: Group of students at Children's Workshop School in Manhattan's East Village have retrieved numerous old coins, ticket stubs and other artifacts from in between floorboards and inside classroom closets--cataloging, preserving and documenting each object; some items tie in directly with American history, while others offer intriguing glimpses into school's past.
